tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  sensor_location VARCHAR(100),
  sensor_value FLOAT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE sensors (
    sensor_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    sensor_type TEXT,
    location TEXT,
    value FLOAT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
    anomaly_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id),
    anomaly_type TEXT,
    anomaly_description TEXT,
    detection_algorithm TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE anomaly_records (
  record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  anomaly_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE sensors (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  location TEXT,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  sensor_value FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE readings (
  reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  reading_value FLOAT,
  reading_datetime TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id)
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
  anomaly_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  reading_id INT,
  anomaly_details TEXT,
  detected_datetime TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (reading_id) REFERENCES readings(reading_id)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE,
  password_hash VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE alerts (
  alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  anomaly_id INT,
  alert_message TEXT,
  alert_datetime TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (anomaly_id) REFERENCES anomalies(anomaly_id)
)
